jurisdiction.title: Laurent Clerc National Deaf Education Center

BE2224730B394768807448051AD5DB4D.description: Use signs to inquire for the fingerspelling of those signs (e.g., TABLE to get fs T-A-B-L-E).

35795F9B019B4D5F99D7932D34E57EAF.description:
Know and apply grade-level parameters and sign analysis skills
in decoding signs both in isolation and in context.

F951D060667C464DA0CC6F9E9920A4F7.description:
Can fingerspell words, including short words and names of
people or places (e.g., own name, fs T-A-R-G-E-T, fs J-O-H-N).

7DED6C38662E40388A4177AB604B3253.description:
Can see connections between initialized forms and
alphabet letters (e.g., name signs, WATER, FAMILY).

A1B3E5A9E8F540A0A999EB2F53680F2B.description:
Demonstrate understanding of initialized and lexicalized forms
of fingerspelled words.

40B77EEE272549FA95191E36A0EA64E5.description: Recognize that some signs have fingerspelling equivalents.

0637E1ACFB5F469AA0973359ACF7F5E1.description: Connect fingerspelling with English in print.

D0FE2357EA034353BD8D1F0521973C4A.description:
Recognize that fingerspelled words are represented by
specific sequences of handshapes produced from in to out.

BC2F531043BA4E028F0DA8BE6993CF7A.description:
Demonstrate understanding of ways fingerspelled signs are
formed and their uses.

042FBE5770154DB289420A04B8FDED85.description:
Use signs and phrases acquired through conversations, signing
and being signed to, and responding to texts.

BC8CB6D7593047FDB1CD585F4A33DD53.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing
the same general action (e.g., WALK-quickly, WALK-slowly,
WALK-clumsily).

A190009E0E04451983B8A84526F57F1C.description:
Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring
verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites
(antonyms) (e.g., WANT/DON’T-WANT, LIKE/DON’T-LIKE).

05A11C235CE64A6DB7010C6CA6455F3A.description: Use role-shifting and/or non-manual markers to represent categories (e.g., shapes, food) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

670AA22D5A0F473FB3F2858926F4260A.description:
With guidance and support from adults, explore sign
relationships and nuances in sign meanings.

925F5693D7C9469792311EEBF05729F0.description: Use the most frequently occurring affixes and compound words (e.g., LAW-PERSON, WOOD+CUT-PERSON, TREE+HOUSE) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown sign.

0E91A6514AE84C038BEA7A81077F626F.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflections (e.g., SIT-FORA-LONG-TIME, SHE-GIVES-HIM) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown sign.

060B075D00C74BCD9EA5023C06B24030.description: Identify new meanings for similar signs and apply them accurately (e.g., SAME vs. LIKE, BUT vs. DIFFERENT).

D48E2FCF364543C1AAE1ABDACDE00A6B.description:
Use context to identify the meaning of unknown signs,
fingerspelled words, and phrases.

ACFD949568B8453B950CD76F54F829A3.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiplemeaning
signs, fingerspelled words, and phrases based on
kindergarten viewing and content.

17A446E2D16B4128A145D6701002B57B.description: Use inflection to indicate temporal markers (e.g., movement, non-manual signals).

9FF7AA5876DB4E18BE39B5849D8C4854.description: Use pronouns as spatial referents (e.g., BOTH-OF-US, BOTHOF-THEM, CL: 1 person). j. Use inflection to indicate temporal markers (e.g., movement, non-manual signals).

7E12B325CEAB40EDAD1A18834E95874B.description: Produce sentences with indicating verbs (e.g., BOY-THERETELL-ME).

2AE8EB0FF3034CAEBC2109AE77C8B200.description: Use non-manual markers and classifiers to produce frequently occurring adjectives and adverbs.

8F9767556A90438C8184523A45ECFDB9.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

0B6BFCE5883F4FD7BFFC2CFABFB0F3FF.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions through referents (e.g., CL: 3 CAR NEXT-TO CL-5 TREE, HURT-ONTUMMY).).

BDEC22D202F84034B52FC25AF61AD9C6.description: Use question signs and non-manual markers (e.g., WHO-Q, WHAT-Q, WHY-Q, WHERE-Q, HOW-Q, WHEN-Q).

60882BD7285646CAAD1AB81EFB114B17.description: Form plural nouns by modifying parameters.

5D02AFAEF3D246CF8AA5D37559F2543A.description: Use frequently occurring nouns, verbs, and depictions.

09670A8EEF2F4C2B9FA83F5ED8E7EB6D.description: Use the full range of handshapes.

85B65D43EB8F4113B5E8696833E5D6FC.description:
Demonstrate command of the structure of standard ASL
grammar and usage when signing (live and published).

9D688A21D2B046E484954BABD04801C2.description: Sign clearly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

C315D38C7A4941E1BA0ABB23B115562A.description:
Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as
desired to provide additional detail.

C5010DEDF0904333B1522AB1FD8AD75E.description:
Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with
prompting and support, provide additional detail.

2C8B971ED8494C73A6B8D39A49CC5440.description:
Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get
information, or clarify something that is not understood.

3D60D62503984CC9A720616C0A3789BF.description:
Confirm understanding of storytelling or storysigning or
information signed or through other media by asking and
answering questions about key details and requesting
clarification if something is not understood.

575E24758A3C40C2851289CE37B5B896.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

427E7456CFD349ACA4EFE0D3F0BCF1BD.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., attending to
others and taking turns signing about the topics and texts
under discussion).

BBC238993FDF47FAA0E11DE89D05ED79.description:
Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners
about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in
small and larger groups.

01D74F5B82E242B385E02446B8893B3C.description:
Publish signing over short time frames (e.g., a single sitting or
a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes,
and audiences

7609240427A44A07B3159C46AC78AEBD.description:
With guidance and support from adults, recall information
from experiences or gather information from provided sources
to answer a question.

72885607E4E44B078E9D99F80391E9A0.description:
Participate in shared research and signing projects (e.g.,
explore a number of texts by a favorite author and/or signer
and express opinions about them).

4F25754D85AC4A5BA379E61523AB6B03.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

2A82BDCCE69A428F8E4184561136FB9C.description:
With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety
of digital tools to produce and publish signing, including in
collaboration with peers.

AA7F30A0FBE84EE4ADB0CF64D3C86475.description:
With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions
and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen
signing as needed.

7E291E452333491E8F10068F048D1312.description: Production and Distribution of Published Signing

0FA4CC8CF59A4A1A83CB0BEE6D2EBAAC.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and signing to
compose a visual-story map narrating a single event or
several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the
order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what
happened.

89F42CAD53C84AB4A7A9D3D5CA571A6A.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and signing to
compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name
what they are signing about and supply some information
about the topic.

4A5D74D6CE0D4D00A127C06FFAAA7A45.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and signing to
compose opinion pieces in which they tell a viewer the topic
or the name of the text they are signing about and state an
opinion or preference about the topic or text (e.g., My favorite
text is …).

42C5FCEA2D1A4AC09F44EB5DCE53E301.description: View and sign on-level texts with purpose and understanding.

C5B1D0F338F248F78ABB4D2C89427B69.description:
Identify meaning of numerically incorporated signs (e.g.,
1-YEAR-OLD vs. ONE-O’CLOCK = TIME+ONE).
 f. Recognize non-manual markers of signs inform their
meanings (e.g., PUZZLED,)

0747F47FC42E48469CF6C40DDC0EB89E.description:
Recognize signs with inflections (e.g., comparatives,
superlatives, and plural; SIT-FOR-A-LONG-TIME, SHE-GIVESHIM).

537B08DE669948EEA065EF1D4F123588.description:
Recognize signs incorporate agentive suffix (e.g., TEACHER =
TEACH+PERSON, PILOT = PLANE+PERSON).

6EA6E0A7CAAE4B5E99536125E97E99DE.description:
Recognize that specific classifiers represent specific nouns
(e.g., vehicle, people, structures, elements).

B052416978A1471C92B719A6C115F131.description:
Recognize common high-frequency signs (e.g., LIKE, WANT,
WHY).

19847F5EBED8416C85730FD7A7CCD555.description:
Know and apply grade-level sign analysis skills in decoding
signs.

E632C62822DA4DEDAF29499DCAF31634.description: Manipulate parameters to make new meaning.

351D4A0EDE574AE8906E4303F576189F.description: Count, produce, blend, and segment parameters in signs.

EB11A2610F3D4AF3A87C88385893A063.description: Identify the phonological parameters in ASL.

FD0883BCB7004D8D85C32D47B8381811.description: Recognize that signs are separated by parameters.

86C386F33EBF4A799BB1D800CBF6EAAA.description:
Demonstrate understanding of signs and parameters
(phonemes).

6A93E1FDFB6548ACA146E415BC0E3D12.description: Recognize that specific classifiers have specific meanings.

F60E8F912D9C4267822DEFEDFAC646FA.description: Recognize that non-manual markers have meanings.

A6B6FA7D19C8424FB5E48B8582543F17.description:
Recognize that signs are represented by a combination of
parameters.

3B8EF9DA6E734FF3A4EDD408F27891E6.description:
Recognize the structure of the signing space (i.e., head,
trunk, arm, and hand).

FE36225BC24E4B4DB0A6B2D8439B1417.description:
Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic
features of sign.

047E58BD59F3446A9311A61DF3CC2860.description:
Actively engage in group viewing activities with purpose and
understanding.

7096824766A54745B5A7FFD220F6CB96.description: Range of Viewing and Level of Text Complexity

7FEDED50788940B0B0D05A29BBBD5B61.description:
With prompting and support, identify basic similarities and
differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in
illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

094213B1805344049AAA2E6BFACF180C.description:
With prompting and support, identify the reasons a signer
gives to support points in a text.

99BB5B45E1E146199B870C8907651D98.description:
With prompting and support, describe the relationship
between illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g.,
what person, place, thing, or idea an illustration depicts in the
text).

9F0DAA4370E1403CA30F5A1F9D2F7B35.description:
Name the author and signer of a text and define the role of
each in presenting the ideas or information.

74ED09F06F074151B93B858227998042.description: Identify the beginning, body, and ending of a text.

7C97343D260B4564B13FB96F969825E1.description:
With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about
unknown signs and fingerspelled words.

373420C495174664A63B1497326E04F8.description:
With prompting and support, describe the connection
between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of
information in a text.

7CA7C0637C2B47BF97BD245E73CD2538.description:
With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell
key details of a text

6A684249E6F64C77A0C12B545062C3F4.description:
With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about
key details.

823917C2A5254BB7B99D027C3ECC2813.description:
Actively engage in group viewing activities with purpose and
understanding.

004D0E51EAB04D55A81708C6F42E2783.description: Range of Viewing and Level of Text Complexity

AE2217241E294A79826467721E066086.description:
With prompting and support, compare and contrast the
adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

6C0819E988AF43AF88904FB7FBFB98C9.description:
With prompting and support, describe the relationship
between illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g.,
what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

470421662BD54513863192F39629D6B9.description:
With prompting and support, name the author and signer of a
story and define the role of each in telling the story.

2746E91CD00F4C3CA50E0ADAF693877E.description:
Recognize common types of text (e.g., storysigning,
storytelling, poems).

80562E04250746CC9A1DB8DBBB942622.description:
Ask and answer questions about unknown fingerspelled words
or signs in a text.

B71343F623F14236BA71E3DAE82CA235.description:
With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and
major events in a story.

6840E0F47F3E4055A06BB37112053376.description:
With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including
key details.

B42E5C61E59D4E0F94CBA3A01D589BD4.description:
With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about
key details in a text
